result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. Keister was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael A. Keister is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael A. Keister was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 01:53 PM Defendant Michael A. Keister in court with attorney Jeffrey Ocwieja.  Defendant Michael A. Keister in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court makes record of current case status.  DOC recommends, and State and Defense concur with recommendation:  3 yrs WSP - 18 mo initial conf., 18 mo extended supervision.  Concurrent to any/all other cases.  Any financial obligations still owed to be converted to civil judgment.  Defendant does qualify for both WSP programs.    Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.

Defendant Micheal A. Keister in court with attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court hears plea agreement.  Allen moves to dismiss Count 2, Granted.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.  Def enters NC plea to Count 1.  Defendant sworn.  ADA Allen waives jury trial.  No victim, so no victim contact related.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation.  Court finds defendant guilty as to Count 12, orders Sentence Withheld, probation 3 years concurrent to 18CF05 and 17CF159.  Conditions - successful completion to drug Court and follow any DOC requests as to treatment.  Court costs and CPS charge waived (they were ordered in 1Cf5).  Court advises fo no guns, no voting.  If there is credit for time served, defense counsel to provide that to the Court within 30 days.  Post Conviction Rights form filed.

Attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day in court.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Decision is not complete - discussion of basis.  Atty Meyer-O'Day will submit supplement within a week on injunctive order issue.  State requests a week to respond.  Filing by 06/02/2017, response by 06/16/2017.  Sauk County case is postponed to October.  If decision in this case is done prior to next hearing, Judge will mail it out.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on May 26, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Michael A. Keister in court with attorney Suzanne Edwards.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge Koehler recused herself due to involvement in Iowa County treatment court.   Motion before the Court is for expulsion from treatment court due to pending violent charges in Sauk County.  Argument is in favor of allowing for a fair hearing on the matter of the classification of "violent offender" prior to conviction.   State responds in objection to motion - gives basis.  Court will not make ruling today, but rather will continue for further advisement.  The ruling on this motion will determine the outcome of this case.  Parties agree there is no urgency in the decision.  Motion is both facial and as applied challenge.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Michael A. Keister in court with attorney Suzanne Edwards.  Defendant Michael A. Keister in custody.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ct 2:  dismissed.  Defendant sworn.  PLQ - colloquy given and knowing waiver accepted.  Request to have sentencing hearing on a different date to allow counsel to research some information needed for sentencing.  Joint recommendation will require status of possible drug court, depending on Sauk County case(s)/charge(s) - if DC is available, 2 yrs probation w/ participation and completeion of DC, costs, DNA surcharge, DNA collection, no possession of controlled substance.  If DC is not available - 4 mo jail.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 14, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
